column3: This makes changes like that proposed in #15633 much easier to make (I have a relatively small diff to the test that would support that change in particular, should we want to adopt a different behavior).
I've taken a bunch of the feedback and cherry-picked a few commits from @jnewbery's branch, and updated this PR.  Old version is here: https://github.com/sdaftuar/bitcoin/commits/15660.1
tested ACK f97b82149a5cda1443f8f1d085b95c7987b9ba1f. Please squash commits.
utACK 7813eb1db132c023902ad945995cc32a325893ca\n\nTravis failure is unrelated. I've restarted it.
Nit: Since `self` is not used -- this could be a function instead of a method?
This comment is no longer accurate and can be removed.

The first argument to `getnewaddress()` is `label` (the second argument is `address_type`) so this doesn't actually create a bech32 address. Consider using named arguments to avoid this class of bug.\n\nGiven that the test passes anyway, is it actually testing what you want?
I suggest you combine this with `make_utxos()`, since both are called only once.
Since there's only one node under test now, all of these methods can drop the `node` argument.
`test_compct()` always takes the same `version` so that argument can be dropped.\n\nSame is true for most of these subtest functions.
Default network services are `NODE_NETWORK | NODE_WITNESS` so this argument doesn't need to be passed.
Eliminated this in the latest version.
